channel.title: Favorite Holiday Food?
channel.description: Whether it be Christmas, Hanukkah, Thanksgiving, or whatever you celebrate. What is your favorite seasonal food that is only around the time of year? I'll post mine after I finish eating my chocolate covered Christmas tree.

item.title: Favorite Holiday Food?
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

It’s a tie between pumpkin pie and honey-glazed ham.

item.description:

AtomicInt_:

Anyone here ever had pumpkin cheese cake? Oh my god it’s fucking orgasmic.

Well since we are talking pumpkins, any coffee fans try the pumpkin spice coffee. Magnificent.

item.title: Favorite Holiday Food?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:27, topic:469110”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=586177.msg4162631#msg4162631 date=1353282741]

[quote author=KroniKz_ link=topic=586177.msg4162439#msg4162439 date=1353267966]
I enjoy stuffing very much.
My mom makes the best stuffing made from scratch ever. I am very excited for Thanksgiving.

I also enjoy the 7 seven fish dinner for christmas (italian culture)
[/quote]does she use home made buttermilk biscuits, chicken broth, and home mad cornbread ? <3

[/quote]Shut up.[/quote]it was a serious question actually haha oddly enough it’s one of my favorites as well but it isn’t a holiday dish in my house we have it like once a month.

Read full topic

[quote author=Uncalled link=topic=586177.msg4162427#msg4162427 date=1353267670]

Pumpkin Pie, Egg Nog (If drinks count), uhh, oh, don’t forget Pecan Pie!
[/quote]I see pumpkin, and pecan, pie in stores year-round.

Pumpkin pie is considered seasonal during Thanksgiving, and I just like pecan pie.
[/quote]I bought one in July.[/quote]
Not my fault they harvest pumpkins year round
